alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:07PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Scott, north central Muscatine and southeastern Cedar Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 707 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tipton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bennett around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wilton and Durant. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 268 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
